intro: Barleria napalensis, commonly known as the narrowleaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Barleria napalensis is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
